entry.title: Modern Warfare 3 Game Update Correction - No More Sudden Stops in Application
entry.content:
Complete Teardown Application Recovery Tutorial ‚Äì No More Crashes

Playing Teardown game but the constant crashing issue blocks you from the destructible voxel world? Don‚Äôt worry. Whether you‚Äôre encounteringTeardown crashing at startup, on quicksave, or during the gameplay, we‚Äôve put together some working fixes for you. Read on to check them out!

Disclaimer: This post includes affiliate links

If you click on a link and make a purchase, I may receive a commission at no extra cost to you.

Before getting started

At the very beginning of troubleshooting, you should check if your PC specs satisfy the minimum system requirements of Teardown. If not, you‚Äôll need to upgrade your rig or run the game on another machine.

OSWindows 10 (Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system)
ProcessorQuad Core CPU
Memory4 GB RAM
GraphicsNVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 or better
Storage1 GB available space

Minimum system requirements of Teardown

According to Teardown‚Äôs official guide , this game cannot run on Intel graphics cards.

If Teardown still crashes even though your components are more than enough, check out the methods below to fix the issue right away.

Try these fixes

You don‚Äôt have to try them all. Simply work your way down the list until you find the one that does the trick.

  1. Stop overclocking
  2. Allow Teardown through controlled folder access
  3. Temporarily disable the antivirus software
  4. Update your graphics card driver
  5. Verify the integrity of game files
  6. Reinstall Teardown

Fix 1 ‚Äì Stop overclocking

Many players attempted to overclock their GPU or CPU to enhance game performance. However, overclocking will possibly result in an unstable system and cause your game to crash.

To see if that‚Äôs the case,turn off your overclocking utilities (if you‚Äôre using any like MSI Afterburner) andset the clock speed back to the default . If the crashing problem isn‚Äôt mitigated, there are more fixes below.

Fix 2 ‚Äì Allow Teardown through controlled folder access

If Teardown crashes when you do a quicksave, the game is probably blocked by Windows Security which protects against viruses and malware. To ensure the game gets full access to necessary files and data, you can add it as an allowed app following the steps below:

1) Click theStart button, and clickSettings .

2) ClickUpdate & Security .

3) ClickWindows Security >Virus & threat protection .

4) ClickManage settings .

5) Scroll down and clickManage Controlled folder access .

6) When Controlled folder access is enabled, you can clickAllow an app through Controlled folder access .

7) ClickAdd an allowed app >Browse all apps , and choose Teardown as a trusted app.

Relaunch the game to see if crashing persists. If unluckily yes, then go ahead with next fix.

Fix 3 ‚Äì Temporarily disable the antivirus software

Antivirus aims to prevent potential security threats on computer, but it‚Äôs sometimes overprotective and can interfere with your games the wrong way. To see if that‚Äôs the cause, turn off your antivirus programs and re-open Teardown.

Be extra careful about what sites you visit, what emails you open and what files you download when your antivirus is disabled.

If the game runs smoothly now, add Teardown to the exception list of your anti-virus programs so you can use both without conflicts. If this method doesn‚Äôt work, move towards the next fix.

Fix 4 ‚Äì Update your graphics card driver

Graphics card matters a lot to video game performance. If you‚Äôre using afaulty or outdated graphics driver, you may constantly bump into Teardown crashing. Updating the driver can effectively fix bugs, improve stability and boost your gaming experience.

There‚Äôre two ways you can get the right driver for your graphics card:manually orautomatically .

Option 1 ‚Äì Update the graphics driver manually

First off, make sure what GPU you‚Äôre using and then go to the manufacturer‚Äôs website:

  • AMD
  • NVIDIA

Search for drivers corresponding with your specific flavor of Windows version and download the driver manually. Upon completion, double-click on the downloaded file and follow the on-screen instructions to install the driver.

Option 2 ‚Äì Automatically update your graphics driver (recommended)

If you don‚Äôt have the time, patience or computer skills to update your video and monitor drivers manually, you can, instead, do it automatically with Driver Easy . Driver Easy will automatically recognize your system and find the correct drivers for your exact graphics card, and your Windows version, and it will download and install them correctly:

1) Download and install Driver Easy.

2) Run Driver Easy and click theScan Now button. Driver Easy will then scan your computer and detect any problem drivers.

3) Click theUpdate button next to the flagged graphics driver to automatically download the correct version of that driver, then you can manually install it (you can do this with theFREE version ).

Or clickUpdate All to automatically download and install the correct version of all the drivers that are missing or out of date on your system. (This requires the Pro version which comes with full support and a 30-day money back guarantee. You‚Äôll be prompted to upgrade when you clickUpdate All .)

You can do it for free if you like, but it‚Äôs partly manual.

The Pro version of Driver Easy comes with full technical support.
If you need assistance, please contact Driver Easy‚Äôs support team at support@drivereasy.com .

Launch Teardown to test the game performance with an updated graphics driver. Still no luck? Then try the next solution.

Fix 5 ‚Äì Verify the integrity of game files

Missing or damaged game files are known as the most common cause of PC game crashing. To fix it, you should verify the integrity of your game files on Steam, which just takes a few steps:

1) Run Steam and select theLibrary tab.

Click here

2) Right-click Teardown and clickProperties .

3) Navigate to theLocal Files tab, and clickVerify Integrity of Game Files .

Wait for Steam to detect and repair the corrupted game files, and then you can check whether Teardown stops crashing or not. If not, have a look at the last fix.

Fix 6 ‚Äì Reinstall Teardown

If none of the fixes above helps your case, try reinstallation as the last resort, as there may be stubborn issues with your previous installation.

1) Launch Steam and navigate to theLibrary tab.

2) Right-clickTeardown from the game list and clickManage >Uninstall .

3) ClickUninstall to confirm.

After you‚Äôre done with the steps above, download and install Teardown again. The freshly installed game is supposed to work perfectly.

Hopefully one of the fixes above helps you solve the Teardown crashing issue. If you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to leave a comment below.üôÇ

entry.title: Resolved: Dealing with Death Stranding PC Bugs and Crashes Effectively
entry.content:
End Lost Ark‚Äôs Endless PC Crashing: Effective Techniques Revealed Here

The long-waited global release of Lost Ark is finally here. While many players are enjoying this masterpiece, there are also quite a few reports of the game constantly crashing on PC, with or without an error code. The good news is there are some known fixes available.

Try these fixes

You may not need to try them all, just work your way down the list until you find the one that does the trick.

  1. Verify and repair game files
  2. Close unnecessary background programs
  3. Update your graphics driver
  4. Make sure your system is up-to-date
  5. Check your antivirus software
  6. Turn off overlays
  7. Perform a clean boot
  8. Try on a different server
  9. Scan and repair Windows

The screenshots below have been mostly taken from a Windows 10 operating system. If you are using Windows 11, please be aware that the visual appearance of your screen may vary slightly, but the steps to perform the task remain consistent.

Fix 1: Verify and repair game files

The first quick fix you can try is to scan and repair missing or corrupted game files. You can easily get it done via the Steam client:

  1. Launch Steam and find Lost Ark in your library. Right-click the game then clickProperties .
  2. UnderInstalled Files , clickVerify integrity of game files .
  3. It may take a while for Steam to complete the scan. If any game files are found corrupted or missing, Steam will replace or add the new game files for you.

If verifying and repairing the game files doesn‚Äôt solve your problem, try the next fix.

Fix 2: Close unnecessary background programs

Applications running in the background could interfere with Lost Ark and cause the crashing issue. Or, these programs may take up the resources that are required for the game and thus throttle the game performance. You can kill the processes via the Task Manager and see if it helps. Here‚Äôs how:

  1. PressCtrl andShift andEsc at the same time to open the Task Manager.
  2. Under theProcesses tab, look for the processes that are eating up the resources. Right-click the process and clickEnd task .

PS: there are some knownprograms that may interfere with Steam games . If you‚Äôre not sure which programs seem to have triggered the crashing issue, feel free to refer to the list below and check your PC.

  • Anti-virus tool
  • Anti-spyware software
  • VPN software
  • Peer-to-Peer (P2P) clients
  • Video/Voice chat applications
  • Stream applications
  • IP filtering/blocking programs

Launch Lost Ark to test if the crashing issue is fixed now. If the problem persists, try the next fix.

Fix 3: Update your graphics driver

Lost Ark crashing may suggest a driver issue because the latest GPU drivers are essential for video games. If your graphics driver is outdated or faulty, it could affect your gaming performance, and you may even get errors and crashes.

You can update your graphics driver manually, by visiting the manufacturer‚Äôs website (NVIDIA /AMD ), downloading the latest correct installer, and installing step by step. But if you don‚Äôt have the time or patience to do that manually, you can use Driver Easy to update automatically:

  1. Download and install Driver Easy.
  2. Run Driver Easy and click the Scan Now button. Driver Easy will then scan your computer and detect any problem drivers.
  3. Click the Update button next to the flagged graphics card driver to automatically download the correct version of the driver, then you can manually install it (you can do this with the FREE version).

Or click Update All to automatically download and install the correct version of all the drivers that are missing or out of date on your system. (This requires the Pro version which comes with full support and a 30-day money-back guarantee. You‚Äôll be prompted to upgrade when you click Update All.)

The Pro version of Driver Easy comes with full technical support.
If you need assistance, please contact Driver Easy‚Äôs support team at support@drivereasy.com .

Reboot your PC and launch Lost Ark to see if you still get random crashes.

If this doesn‚Äôt help, move on to the next fix.

Fix 4: Make sure your system is up-to-date

Another quick but effective fix is to install all the Windows updates. You want to make sure your system is up-to-date so the known system bugs can be fixed. It may also solve compatibility issues with programs on your PC, especially a large game like Lost Ark, and help with the crashing issue.

  1. On your keyboard, pressWin+R (the Windows logo key and the R key) to invoke the Run box. Type or pastecontrol update and clickOK .
  2. ClickCheck for updates . Windows will then check for available updates. (Or click Restart now if it prompts ‚ÄúRestart required‚Äù)

It‚Äôs important that Lost Ark is not running while Windows is installing the updates in the background. When Windows is writing data into the drive, it could interfere with the gameplay.

If you‚Äôve allowed Windows to automatically install the system updates for you, make sure you double-check that the Windows Update client is not running while you‚Äôre playing Lost Ark.

If this doesn‚Äôt help or your system is already up-to-date, try the next fix.

Fix 5: Check your antivirus software

As we briefly mentioned above, antivirus software may affect Steam game performance and trigger the crashing issue in Lost Ark. It usually happens when your antivirus program detects something like a ‚Äúvirus‚Äù in your game files and shuts down your game.

You can try adding the Lost Ark game executable and Steam client to thewhitelist/exception list of your antivirus software. Or, you cantemporarily disable your antivirus program and test the issue. If the crashing issue doesn‚Äôt return when the antivirus program is off, then you know it was the cause. Consider using a different antivirus program, or report the issue to the software supplier or game developers for further assistance.

Make sure you stay cautious when you turn off the antivirus app and do NOT download anything from the internet when your computer is not under protection.

If the crashing issue persists, try the next fix.

Fix 6: Turn off overlays

Some players found that overlays have caused Lost Ark to crash randomly, and the issue didn‚Äôt return when they turned off the overlays. You can give it a try as well to see if it helps with your crashing issue. Here‚Äôs how:

Steam

  1. Launch Steam, and navigate to Settings >> In-game .
  2. Toggle off Enable the Steam Overlay while in-game .
  3. Click OK to save the changes.

If you‚Äôre not experiencing random crashes for other Steam games, you can try to disable the Steam overlay only for Lost Ark.

  1. In your Steam library, right-click Lost Ark and click Properties .
  2. Under the General tab ,toggle off Enable the Steam Overlay while in-game .

Discord

  1. Launch Discord. On the bottom-left, click thegear-shaped icon to open the user settings.
  2. On the left panel, scroll down and findGame Overlay . Toggle offEnable in-game overlay .
  3. Run Lost Ark and test the issue.

You can also check other common overlays that gamers like to use, such as Twitch and NVIDIA GeForce, and turn them off.

If disabling the overlays doesn‚Äôt solve your problem, try the next fix.

Fix 7: Perform a clean boot

The fixes above mostly cover the interference by the third-party programs, but we need to check Windows services as well. By doing a clean boot, you can identify if there‚Äôs any background service messing with Lost Ark.

A clean boot will start your PC with the minimum sets of drivers and services that Windows requires to run.

Here‚Äôs how to perform a clean boot:

  1. On your keyboard, press theWindows logo + R keys simultaneously to open the Run dialog box. Typemsconfig and hit Enter.
  2. Under theServices tab, checkHide all Microsoft services , then clickDisable all andOK .
  3. Go to theStartup tab, clickOpen Task Manager .


4. Under theStartup tab, click each startup item then clickDisable until you‚Äôve disabled all startup items.

5. Restart your PC.

You can now launch Lost Ark to test if you still get errors and crashes. If the issue persists, jump to thelast fix .

If Lost Ark no longer crashes on your PC, this means at least one of the startup items you disabled was causing the problem.

Here‚Äôs how to find out which one(s):

  1. On your keyboard, press theWindows logo + R keys simultaneously to open the Run dialog box. Typemsconfig and hit Enter.
  2. Under theServices tab, tick theHide all Microsoft services checkbox**,** then tick the checkboxes in front ofthe first five items in the list.
    Then clickApply andOK .
  3. Reboot your computer and launch Lost Ark. If the game once again crashes, then you know that one of the services you ticked above is conflicting with it. If Lost Ark runs just fine, then the above five services are fine, and you‚Äôll have to keep looking for the offending service.
  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 above until you find the service that conflicts with Lost Ark.

NOTE: We recommend testing five items in a group since it‚Äôs more efficient, but you‚Äôre welcome to do it at your own pace.

If you don‚Äôt find any problematic services, you‚Äôll need totest the startup items .Here‚Äôs how:

  1. Right-click anywhere empty on your taskbar and clickTask Manager .
  2. Switch to theStartup tab, andenable the first five startup items .
  3. Reboot and try launching Lost Ark.
  1. Repeat until you find the startup item that‚Äôs conflicting with Lost Ark.
  2. Disable the problem program and reboot your PC.

If doing a clean boot doesn‚Äôt solve your problem, you can safely assume that the Windows services and startup items aren‚Äôt responsible for the crashing issue. You can go back to your normal startup. Also, there‚Äôs one more fix you can try.

Fix 8: Try on a different server

According to some players, the crashing issue can be solved by playing on a new server and creating a new character. If you‚Äôre running into similar problems, try playing the game on a different server to see if Lost Ark still crashes on your PC.

This could be triggered by corrupted character data on the server-side. Note that this bug has been existing and was acknowledged back in the beta stage, so we can expect an official patch that fixes this issue.

Fix 9: Repair corrupted system files

If you‚Äôre experiencing performance issues like random crashes in Lost Ark and none of the fixes helped, chances are you‚Äôre looking at a system issue. In addition to game files, corrupted system files may also cause the game to crash. You can use the System File Checker tool (sfc /scannow ) to look for any critical system issues first, but most of the time, manual repair is required.

To use a more powerful tool to repair your system, we recommend giving Fortect a try. It‚Äôs a professional system repair software that specializes in solving program and security issues found on your PC. Fortect can also diagnose your Windows problems and fix corrupted system files and services without affecting personal data.

  1. Download and install Fortect.
  2. Open Fortect. It will run a free scan of your PC and give youa detailed report of your PC status .
  3. Once finished, you‚Äôll see a report showing all the issues. To fix all the issues automatically, clickStart Repair (You‚Äôll need to purchase the full version. It comes with a 60-day Money-Back Guarantee so you can refund anytime if Fortect doesn‚Äôt fix your problem).

Fortect comes with a 60-day Money-Back Guarantee. If you‚Äôre not satisfied with Fortect, you can contact support@fortect.com for a full refund.

Hopefully, this article helps! Please feel free to drop a comment down below if you have any suggestions or questions.

  • Lost Ark
  • Steam

entry.title: Common Fixes for When Red Dead Redemption 2 Fails to Load
entry.content:
How to Overcome the Endless Load Screen in Madden 22 ‚Äì Solutions Inside

As the latest entry in the long-running Madden NFL series, Madden 22 is available now. However many players reported that the game is stuck on the loading screen when they try to launch Madden 22. If you‚Äôre plagued by the same issue, don‚Äôt worry. Here are some quick fixes for you.

Disclaimer: This post includes affiliate links

If you click on a link and make a purchase, I may receive a commission at no extra cost to you.

Before you start

Before you move on to the fixes below,try restarting your device first . Sometimes a simple reboot will solve your problem. Besides, you need tomake sure you have installed the latest game patch . EA often releases new updates with bug fixes for console and PC.

If you‚Äôve already done these, go ahead with the fixes below.

Try these fixes

You don‚Äôt have to try them all. Simply work your way down the list until you find the one that works for you.

  1. Restart the modem and router
  2. Run the game as an administrator
  3. Scan and repair your game files
  4. Update your network driver
  5. Change your DNS settings
  6. Delete game data on Xbox
  7. Perform a clean boot
  8. Use a VPN

Fix 1: Restart the modem and router

Many factors can cause Madden 22 stuck on the loading screen. One of them could be connection-related. To troubleshoot your network connection, the first thing you can do is to restart your modem and router. By doing this, the cache will be cleared up and your IP address will be renewed. Here‚Äôs how:

  1. Unplug the modem and router from the power outlet.

    modem


router

  1. Wait for one minute.
  2. Reconnect the modem and router to the power outlet. Make sure the indicators are back to their normal state.

Once you‚Äôre back online, restart Madden 22 to see if you can get past the loading screen.

If not, check out more fixes below.

Click here

Fix 2: Run the game as an administrator

Some programs need administrator rights to function properly. To ensure Madden 22 works properly, you can run the game as an administrator. Here‚Äôs how:

  1. On your desktop, right-click Madden NFL 22 icon and selectProperties .
  2. Navigate to theCompatibility tab. Then check the box next toRun this program as an administrator and clickOK to save changes.

You can repeat the steps above to run Steam or Origin client as an administrator. Then test if the game loads successfully.

If this method can‚Äôt help you get into the game either, move on to the next fix.

Fix 3: Scan and repair your game files

The corrupted or missing game files can also cause Madden 22 stuck on the loading screen. To see if that‚Äôs the case, you can try to scan and repair game files in Steam or Origin. Here‚Äôs how:

Steam

  1. Go to your SteamLIBRARY .
  2. Right-click Madden NFL 22 and selectProperties‚Ä¶ .


3. Select theLOCAL FILES tab, then clickVerify integrity of game files‚Ä¶ .


4. Steam will verify the game‚Äôs files. This process may take several minutes.

Origin

  1. SelectMy Game Library in Origin.
  2. Right-click Madden NFL 22 and selectRepair .
  3. Origin will check your game‚Äôs installation and then automatically download any replacement or missing files.

Once done, run Madden 22 again to check if the game is still stuck on the loading screen.

If the issue persists, continue to the next fix.

Fix 4: Update your network driver

Being stuck on the loading screen could indicate that you have a poor connection, which can be caused by a broken or outdated network driver. To fix this issue, you need to make sure you‚Äôre using the latest network driver.

One way to do that is to visit the motherboard manufacturer‚Äôs website (NVIDIA ,AMD ,Intel ) and search for your model, then download and install the network driver manually. But if you don‚Äôt have the time, patience or computer skills to update the driver manually, you can do it automatically with Driver Easy .

Driver Easy will automatically recognize your system and find the correct drivers for your exact devices, and your Windows version, and it will download and install them correctly.

  1. Download and install Driver Easy.
  2. Run Driver Easy and click theScan Now button. Driver Easy will then scan your computer and detect any problem drivers.
  3. ClickUpdate All to automatically download and install the correct version of all the drivers that are missing or out of date on your system (this requires the Pro version ‚Äì you‚Äôll be prompted to upgrade when you click Update All. If you don‚Äôt want to upgrade to the Pro version, you can also update your drivers with the FREE version. All you need to do is to download them one at a time and manually install them.)

The Pro version of Driver Easy comes with full technical support . If you need assistance, please contact Driver Easy‚Äôs support team at support@drivereasy.com .

After updating your network driver, restart your computer and try relaunching Madden 22 to see if it does load without issue now.

If the issue remains, try the next fix.

Fix 5: Change your DNS settings

If updating your network driver doesn‚Äôt solve your connection problem, you can try setting an alternate DNS, like Google DNS. This will improve the resolution speed and provide you with more security online. Here‚Äôs how to do it:

  1. On your keyboard, press theWindows logo key andI at the same time to open Windows Settings. Then clickNetwork & Internet .
  2. Under Advanced network settings, clickChange adapter options .


3. Right-click your current network and selectProperties .


4. SelectInternet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4) and clickProperties .


5. SelectUse the following DNS server addresses . ForPreferred DNS server , type8.8.8.8 ; and forAlternate DNS server , type8.8.4.4 . ClickOK to save the changes.


6. Next, you need to clear the DNS cache for the changes to apply. On your keyboard, press theWindows logo key and typecmd in the search bar. SelectRun as administrator .


7. In the pop-up window, typeipconfig /flushdns and pressEnter .

Try relaunching Madden 22 and see if it does load without issue now.

If this fix doesn‚Äôt work for you, proceed to the next one.

Fix 6: Delete game data on Xbox

For Xbox players, if you‚Äôre stuck on the loading screen when launching madden 22, you can try to fix this issue by deleting saved game data. Since this cannot be undone, it is highly recommended that you back up your saved game data to online storage before deleting it. Here‚Äôs how:

  1. On Xbox Home, select My games & apps .
  2. Highlight Madden NFL 22, press the Menu button on your controller, then select Manage game & add-ons .
  3. Select the Saved data box, then choose the item you want to delete.

Try launching Madden 22 again to check if it can load normally.

If not, take a look at the next fix.

Fix 7: Perform a clean boot

A clean boot can cut down the number of applications that run when you start your computer. This can help you to identify if there are any conflicts between Madden 22 and another program. Here‚Äôs how:

  1. On your keyboard, press theWindows logo key andR at the same time to invoke the Run dialog box. Then typemsconfig and clickOK .
  2. In the System Configuration window, navigate to theServices tab and check the box toHide all Microsoft Services .


3. Uncheck all the services EXCEPT those belong to your video card or sound card manufacturer, such asRealtek ,AMD ,NVIDIA andIntel . Then clickOK to save the changes.


4. On your keyboard, pressCtrl ,Shift andEsc at the same time to openTask Manager , then navigate to theStartup tab.

5. One at a time, select any programs you suspect might be interfering and clickDisable .

6. Restart your computer.

Once you restart your computer, try launching Madden 22 again and check if the game is still stuck on the loading screen. If not, you can try to enable services one by one until you find the problematic software. Then restart your computer to apply the changes.

Once you find out the problematic program that conflicts with Madden 22, you just need to uninstall it to avoid the issue in the future.

If the game still won‚Äôt load after you disabled all the programs and services, try the last fix below.

Fix 8: Use a VPN

If Madden 22 is still stuck on the loading screen after you try all the fixes above, maybe give VPN a shot. By using a VPN, you can get a better Internet connection during rush hours, which may help you to solve the problem of Madden 22 not loading. Here are some VPNs we recommended:

  • NordVPN
  • Surfshark
  • CyberGhost

Avoid using free VPNs, since they rarely resolve your issues but could bring many problems.

So that‚Äôs it. Hopefully, this post helped. If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to leave a comment below.

  • network issue

T√©l√©charger gratuitement

Un facteur cl√© qui peut ralentir votre exp√©rience de jeu est l‚Äôutilisation d‚Äôun enregistreur de qualit√© inf√©rieure pendant le jeu. C‚Äôest pourquoi notre choix sp√©cial pour optimiser votre PC pour les jeux sur Windows 10 est Gecata by Movavi. Ce programme peut enregistrer le gameplay en 4K et jusqu‚Äô√† 120 FPS sans perte de performance. Il est facile √† utiliser et est livr√© avec une version d‚Äôessai gratuite.

Qu‚Äôest-ce qu‚Äôun FPS faible et comment puis-je le v√©rifier ?

Si votre jeu commence √† ralentir et que l‚Äôimage est saccad√©e, surtout lorsqu‚Äôelle bouge, c‚Äôest que votre taux d‚Äôimages par seconde (IPS) est faible. Cela se produit lorsque le mat√©riel de votre ordinateur a du mal √† faire fonctionner votre jeu ou fait des heures suppl√©mentaires. S‚Äôil travaille trop, la vitesse du jeu ralentit.

La carte graphique travaille pour rendre les images fixes, ou frames, pendant que vous jouez √† un jeu. Elle travaille en collaboration avec d‚Äôautres composants mat√©riels tels que la RAM, le CPU et le GPU pour cr√©er une exp√©rience de jeu compl√®te. En cas d‚Äôarr√™t de l‚Äôun de ces composants, votre FPS commencera √† baisser. La plupart des joueurs pr√©f√®rent un taux de 60 FPS en jouant, mais la plupart des jeux sont en fait tr√®s bien √† 30 FPS.

Le PC surpasse les consoles √† cet √©gard, car il est toujours possible d‚Äôacc√©l√©rer le taux de FPS sur un PC avec des modifications, alors que modifier une console n‚Äôest pas possible. Les joueurs sur PC peuvent √©galement augmenter la fr√©quence de rafra√Æchissement de leur √©cran, modifier d‚Äôautres param√®tres syst√®me pour le jeu, et bien plus encore.

Cet article vous pr√©sente les r√©glages de performance pour les jeux que vous pouvez effectuer sur Windows 10 pour am√©liorer votre exp√©rience de jeu.

Avant de commencer, il est toujours bon d‚Äôavoir un compteur de FPS dans le jeu, afin de pouvoir suivre vos progr√®s et tester les r√©glages qui fonctionnent. De nombreux jeux les ont pr√©install√©s, mais si vous installez MSI Afterburner , vous ne serez jamais sans cet outil utile dans n‚Äôimporte quel jeu.

Comment rendre Windows 10 plus rapide pour les jeux (corrections rapides)

Vous voulez savoir comment rendre Windows 10 plus rapide pour jouer avec une solution rapide ? Suivez ces conseils et recommencez √† jouer !

R√©gler les param√®tres graphiques d‚Äôun jeu

Chaque jeu poss√®de des param√®tres graphiques sp√©cifiques qui peuvent vous aider √† optimiser votre exp√©rience de jeu. En voici trois que vous devriez v√©rifier dans le menu des param√®tres du jeu avant de jouer.

  1. Anti-cr√©nelage : Lorsqu‚Äôun jeu utilise le cr√©nelage, il corrige les petites lignes irr√©guli√®res et in√©gales autour de textures ou d‚Äôobjets sp√©cifiques. Pensez aux lignes floues que vous voyez lorsque l‚Äôherbe appara√Æt dans la plupart des jeux. Chaque jeu poss√®de diff√©rents niveaux d‚Äôanticr√©nelage (SSAA, TAA, MSAA, etc.). - et vous pouvez g√©n√©ralement les modifier dans les param√®tres du jeu pour obtenir de meilleures performances.
  2. Flou de mouvement : Pour rendre les choses plus r√©alistes, les jeux int√®grent des flous de mouvement afin d‚Äô√©muler la vie r√©elle. Le d√©sactiver peut souvent vous aider √† √©conomiser de la puissance graphique.
  3. Synchronisation verticale : Parfois, lorsque vous vous d√©placez rapidement, la carte graphique ne peut pas suivre et l‚Äô√©cran semble se d√©chirer en son milieu. La synchronisation verticale aide √† r√©soudre ce probl√®me mais ajoute un certain d√©calage. Une fa√ßon de corriger ce probl√®me est d‚Äôutiliser le VSync adaptatif ou le Triple Buffering. Vous utiliserez davantage de puissance de la carte graphique, mais vous trouverez un juste milieu entre les d√©chirures et le d√©calage.

Mettez √† jour les pilotes de votre GPU

Le GPU (Graphics Processing Unit) est crucial pour votre exp√©rience de jeu et pour les performances de votre PC dans les jeux, mais vous devez maintenir les pilotes de votre GPU √† jour pour en profiter. De plus, un pilote obsol√®te peut entra√Æner des bogues, des probl√®mes et des pannes du syst√®me. Nous vous recommandons donc de prendre ce probl√®me au s√©rieux et de prendre soin de vos pilotes.

Bien que Windows 10 ne mette pas automatiquement √† jour les pilotes de votre GPU, les fabricants cr√©ent souvent des logiciels sp√©ciaux sous la forme de panneaux de contr√¥le GPU qui effectuent des v√©rifications r√©guli√®res des mises √† jour et vous avertissent si une nouvelle mise √† jour est disponible. N‚Äôignorez pas ces notifications, car le processus de mise √† jour prend peu de temps et peut vous √©viter bien des ennuis pendant le jeu.

Par exemple, selon le fabricant de votre GPU, vous pouvez t√©l√©charger soit Radeon Software Adrenaline, soit GeForce Experience. Ces deux programmes v√©rifient les mises √† jour automatiques et proposent des options d‚Äôoptimisation puissantes. De plus, GeForce Experience comprend un logiciel de capture et de streaming de jeux et fournit des pilotes sp√©ciaux Game Ready, con√ßus par NVIDIA en collaboration avec les principales soci√©t√©s de d√©veloppement de jeux.

Vous pouvez mettre √† jour votre pilote directement √† partir des propri√©t√©s Windows, mais le moyen le plus s√ªr d‚Äôobtenir le dernier pilote est d‚Äôaller directement sur le site Web du fabricant, de choisir votre mod√®le de GPU et de v√©rifier les mises √† jour.

Si vous ne connaissez pas les sp√©cifications de votre GPU, faites un clic droit sur le Bureau, choisissez Param√®tres d‚Äôaffichage, puis Param√®tres d‚Äôaffichage avanc√©s et cliquez sur Propri√©t√©s de l‚Äôadaptateur d‚Äôaffichage.

Voici quelques liens vers les mises √† jour des pilotes des fabricants les plus populaires :

  • Pilotes AMD
  • Pilotes NVIDIA
  • Pilotes Intel Graphics

Installer DirectX 12

DirectX 12 est un outil indispensable pour quiconque souhaite jouer √† des jeux sur Windows 10. Pour faire simple, DirectX est l‚Äôapplication que le jeu utilise pour communiquer avec votre ordinateur et lui dire quoi faire. DirectX 12 est une grande am√©lioration par rapport √† son pr√©d√©cesseur, DirectX 11, car il permet aux cartes graphiques de tirer des ressources de plus d‚Äôun c≈ìur du processeur d‚Äôun PC, ce qui augmente les fr√©quences d‚Äôimages, am√©liore les effets graphiques et r√©duit la consommation d‚Äô√©nergie. Des tests ont montr√© une diff√©rence de 85 √† 300 % dans les performances de jeu entre la version 11 et la version 12.

Pour b√©n√©ficier des fonctionnalit√©s de DirectX 12, le jeu doit avoir √©t√© d√©velopp√© avec cette version. La bonne nouvelle est que la liste de ces jeux s‚Äôallonge chaque jour, car de plus en plus de soci√©t√©s de jeux adoptent cette version.

Pour v√©rifier que vous disposez de la derni√®re version de DirectX, appuyez sur la touche Windows + R, tapez ‚Äúdxdiag‚Äù et cliquez sur OK. L‚Äôoutil de diagnostic DirectX s‚Äôouvre.

Si vous n‚Äôavez pas DirectX 12, allez-y et installez-le ; le processus ne prendra que quelques minutes. Appuyez sur la touche Windows + I, choisissez Mise √† jour et s√©curit√© et cliquez sur V√©rifier les mises √† jour dans l‚Äôonglet Windows. Mise √† jour. Attendez que l‚Äôinstallation se termine.

Utiliser le mode de jeu Windows 10

Voici un moyen simple et rapide d‚Äôoptimiser Windows 10 pour les jeux en utilisant un outil int√©gr√© au syst√®me. Le mode Jeu, apparu dans les versions les plus r√©centes du syst√®me d‚Äôexploitation, est con√ßu pour am√©liorer l‚Äôexp√©rience de jeu en consacrant davantage de ressources syst√®me aux jeux. Il emp√™che √©galement d‚Äôautres programmes, tels que Windows Update, d‚Äôaccaparer les ressources du syst√®me pendant que vous jouez.

Pour localiser les param√®tres du mode jeu, appuyez sur la touche Windows + I, tapez ‚Äúmode jeu‚Äù dans la bo√Æte de recherche et cliquez sur Contr√¥ler le mode jeu pour optimiser votre PC pour les jeux.

Dans le menu qui s‚Äôouvre, cliquez sur Mode Jeu. Passez √† On pour activer le Game Mode. Si votre PC prend en charge le Mode Jeu, le syst√®me optimisera les performances de votre PC pour les jeux.

Si vous ne trouvez pas ces param√®tres, cela signifie que la derni√®re Windows Creators Update n‚Äôest pas install√©e sur votre PC.

G√©rez vos heures actives

Oui, Windows 10 peut installer des mises √† jour et red√©marrer votre ordinateur en plein milieu de votre session de jeu sans m√™me un simple ‚Äúexcusez-moi‚Äù. Ouch. Cela peut √™tre d√©cevant, c‚Äôest le moins que l‚Äôon puisse dire, surtout si vous √™tes un joueur comp√©titif et que votre sortie non planifi√©e peut affecter vos co√©quipiers ou votre classement.

Mais m√™me en l‚Äôabsence de tels red√©marrages ‚Äúen pleine face‚Äù, qui sont en fait assez rares, le t√©l√©chargement des mises √† jour en arri√®re-plan limite vos vitesses de connexion et occupe la m√©moire vive de votre PC.

Bien que votre premi√®re r√©action puisse √™tre de d√©sactiver compl√®tement les mises √† jour automatiques, nous vous le d√©conseillons. La mise √† jour agressive de Windows sans demander la permission est ainsi faite parce que dans les versions pr√©c√©dentes, les utilisateurs ne mettaient pas √† jour de leur propre gr√© et leurs syst√®mes √©taient donc r√©guli√®rement expos√©s aux cybermenaces. Rappelez-vous que les mises √† jour automatiques de Windows ne sont pas l√† uniquement pour ruiner votre raid, mais aussi pour prot√©ger votre syst√®me, le maintenir √† jour et le faire fonctionner de mani√®re optimale.

Ainsi, une autre solution plus ‚Äú douce ‚Äú et bien plus intelligente consiste √† d√©finir vos heures d‚Äôactivit√© de mani√®re appropri√©e. Vous pouvez sp√©cifier vos horaires de jeu et de travail dans Windows et emp√™cher le syst√®me d‚Äôexploitation de t√©l√©charger des mises √† jour pendant ces p√©riodes. Windows utilisera alors vos heures non actives pour mettre √† jour et red√©marrer votre syst√®me.

Pour d√©finir vos heures actives, appuyez sur la touche Windows + I, puis allez dans Mise √† jour et s√©curit√© et cliquez sur Modifier les heures actives. Vous pouvez alors d√©finir jusqu‚Äô√† 18 heures actives, en laissant un intervalle de 6 heures (il faut bien dormir parfois, non ?) pour que Windows installe vos mises √† jour.

Si vous √™tes un joueur de nuit ou si vos heures de sommeil varient consid√©rablement, de sorte que vous ne pouvez pas d√©finir une heure de repos sp√©cifique, nous vous conseillons (en plus de changer vos habitudes de sommeil) de vous assurer que Windows vous rappelle chaque fois qu‚Äôil voudra red√©marrer afin que, si cela se produit pendant que vous jouez, vous puissiez toujours le retarder.

Pour ce faire, retournez √† Windows Update, cliquez sur Advanced options et assurez-vous que l‚Äôinterrupteur sous We‚Äôll show a reminder when we‚Äôre going to restart est activ√©.

R√©glez les param√®tres de vos effets visuels

Les interfaces utilisateur graphiques (IUG) de Windows 10 regorgent d‚Äôeffets visuels fantaisistes. N√©anmoins, ces jolis graphiques d‚Äôarri√®re-plan, dont la plupart sont activ√©s par d√©faut, peuvent affecter la puissance de traitement disponible de votre PC lorsqu‚Äôun jeu est en cours d‚Äôex√©cution au premier plan. Ainsi, une fa√ßon d‚Äôoptimiser Windows 10 pour les performances de jeu est de sacrifier certains, voire tous, ces param√®tres.

Une fois encore, appuyez sur la touche Windows + I. Ensuite, tapez ‚Äúperformance‚Äù et s√©lectionnez Ajuster l‚Äôapparence et les performances de Windows. Dans la fen√™tre qui s‚Äôouvre, choisissez Ajuster pour une meilleure performance. Ensuite, allez dans l‚Äôonglet Avanc√© et v√©rifiez que le param√®tre est appliqu√© aux programmes.

Si vous souhaitez conserver un minimum de graphismes pour que votre interface n‚Äôait pas un aspect si terne, nous vous recommandons de garder au moins ces trois options de la liste coch√©es :

  • Afficher les vignettes au lieu des ic√¥nes.
  • Afficher le contenu de la fen√™tre pendant le glissement.
  • Lisser les bords des polices d‚Äô√©cran.

G√©rer les mises √† jour automatiques de Steam

Le probl√®me ici est le m√™me qu‚Äôavec Windows Mises √† jour. Steam met automatiquement √† jour tous vos jeux, m√™me ceux auxquels vous n‚Äôavez pas jou√© depuis longtemps. Les mises √† jour en arri√®re-plan consomment la m√©moire de votre PC et peuvent ralentir les processus de jeu.

Pour emp√™cher Steam de mettre √† jour les jeux pendant que vous jouez, allez dans votre client Steam et trouvez les options de mise √† jour dans Steam - Param√®tres - T√©l√©chargements. D√©cochez la case Autoriser les t√©l√©chargements pendant le jeu.

Par ailleurs, les jeux sur Steam sont mis √† jour en permanence et il arrive souvent que de nouveaux bogues apparaissent dans les nouvelles mises √† jour ou que certains √©l√©ments cessent de fonctionner.

Pour ramener la version d‚Äôun jeu √† celle dont vous avez besoin, ouvrez Steam, faites un clic droit sur le jeu, choisissez Propri√©t√©s et allez dans l‚Äôonglet B√™ta. Choisissez la version souhait√©e dans le menu d√©roulant.

D√©sactiver les notifications

Les notifications au milieu d‚Äôun jeu consomment de la puissance CPU et peuvent nuire √† votre champ de vision pendant le jeu. Suivez les √©tapes suivantes pour d√©sactiver toutes les notifications avant de jouer :

  1. Appuyez sur la touche Windows ou cliquez sur l‚Äôic√¥ne Windows en bas √† gauche de votre √©cran.
  2. Tapez ‚ÄúNotifications‚Äù dans la barre de recherche et s√©lectionnez Notifications et param√®tres d‚Äôactions dans les r√©sultats.
  3. Lorsque la nouvelle fen√™tre s‚Äôouvre, mettez le commutateur √† bascule situ√© √† c√¥t√© de l‚Äôoption Obtenir des notifications d‚Äôapplications et d‚Äôautres exp√©diteurs sur D√©sactiv√©. Vos notifications sont maintenant d√©sactiv√©es.
  4. Vous pouvez √©galement faire d√©filer la liste et d√©sactiver les notifications par application.

R√©gler le panneau de contr√¥le NVIDIA

Si vous utilisez une carte graphique NVIDIA, il existe des param√®tres sp√©cifiques √† la carte dans le panneau de configuration. Voici quelques-uns des meilleurs param√®tres Windows 10 pour les cartes NVIDIA pour les jeux.

  1. Occlusion ambiante : Activez-la et augmentez son niveau jusqu‚Äô√† 16x.
  2. Filtrage anisotropique : Passez sur Off.
  3. DSR - Facteurs et lissage : D√©sactiver.
  4. Mode faible latence : Activez-le.
  5. Mode de gestion de l‚Äô√©nergie : Passez √† Pr√©f√©rer les performances maximales.
  6. Optimisation Threaded : Passez √† Auto.

R√©gler le centre de contr√¥le AMD/ATI

Les cartes graphiques AMD ont √©galement beaucoup de param√®tres. Certains disent qu‚Äôelles rivalisent m√™me avec leur concurrent NVIDIA. Modifiez ces param√®tres pour optimiser les jeux de Windows 10.

  1. Activez l‚Äôaccentuation des images d‚ÄôAMD en cliquant sur Param√®tres, puis sur Graphiques pour trouver le param√®tre. Vous pouvez l‚Äôactiver pour des jeux individuels ou globalement.
  2. Augmentez vos performances graphiques en utilisant l‚Äôoverclocking. Pour ce faire, cliquez sur l‚Äôonglet Performance, puis sur Tuning, s√©lectionnez Automatique, et enfin GPU Overclocked.
  3. Si vous utilisez une carte AMD, vous n‚Äôavez pas besoin de MSI Afterburner pour contr√¥ler les performances. Il vous suffit d‚Äôappuyer sur Ctrl + Shift + O pour que vos statistiques apparaissent dans le jeu.

R√©duire la r√©solution dans un jeu

Cette solution entre facilement dans la cat√©gorie des ‚Äúsolutions rapides‚Äù. Parfois, votre syst√®me ne peut tout simplement pas g√©rer un jeu, et vous n‚Äôavez pas le temps de chercher des solutions √† plus long terme. Allez dans les param√®tres syst√®me du jeu et r√©duisez la r√©solution d‚Äôun niveau. Surveillez ensuite votre FPS jusqu‚Äô√† ce que les choses s‚Äôam√©liorent.

D√©sactiver l‚Äôacc√©l√©ration de la souris

Celui-ci n‚Äôa rien √† voir avec l‚Äôam√©lioration des performances de votre PC en mati√®re de jeu, mais il s‚Äôagit plut√¥t d‚Äôun conseil pour vous permettre d‚Äôam√©liorer vos performances personnelles en mati√®re de jeu. L‚Äôacc√©l√©ration de la souris est un param√®tre qui fait bouger votre souris en se basant non seulement sur la d√©tection des mouvements physiques mais aussi sur la vitesse. Cette option rend en fait les mouvements de votre souris moins pr√©cis, car elle ajoute un param√®tre suppl√©mentaire au mouvement que vous transmettez √† la souris. √âtant donn√© que la pr√©cision est cruciale pour la pr√©cision de la vis√©e dans les jeux de tir √† la premi√®re personne, si vous √™tes un fan de Call of Duty, Counter-Strike ou Overwatch, vous devriez absolument d√©sactiver cette option.

Pour ce faire, appuyez sur la touche Windows + I. Tapez ‚Äúpointeur de la souris‚Äù dans la zone de recherche. Choisissez Modifier l‚Äôaffichage ou la vitesse du pointeur de la souris. Dans la fen√™tre qui s‚Äôouvre, allez dans l‚Äôonglet Options du pointeur et d√©cochez la case Am√©liorer la pr√©cision du pointeur.

Vous pouvez √©galement modifier le curseur de la vitesse du pointeur pour cr√©er la configuration qui vous convient le mieux.

Comment am√©liorer les performances de jeu sur Windows 10 (corrections avanc√©es)

Vous ne savez toujours pas comment rendre Windows 10 plus rapide pour les jeux ? Utilisez ces correctifs avanc√©s pour une solution √† long terme.

Optez pour un SSD

Passer d‚Äôun disque dur √† un disque SSD n‚Äôam√©liorera pas radicalement les performances de vos jeux, mais cela peut vous aider √† r√©duire consid√©rablement les temps de chargement. Il est vrai que les disques durs SSD peuvent √™tre assez chers et il peut sembler que les temps de chargement ne sont pas une question si importante pour investir votre argent. Mais si ce n‚Äôest probablement pas la premi√®re chose √† laquelle vous pensez lorsque vous acc√©l√©rez votre ordinateur portable, ce n‚Äôest pas non plus la derni√®re. Les jeux d‚Äôaujourd‚Äôhui prennent de plus en plus d‚Äôespace disque, donc si vous voulez jouer aux derniers jeux, passer d‚Äôun disque dur √† un disque SSD peut √™tre un v√©ritable gain de temps et vos temps de chargement de jeu peuvent passer de 30-40 secondes √† 2-3, ce qui est assez significatif.

Quant √† l‚Äôaspect financier, si un gros SSD pour votre syst√®me d‚Äôexploitation et vos jeux est trop cher pour vous, prenez un petit SSD pour votre syst√®me d‚Äôexploitation et gardez un gros disque dur pour les jeux.

Mettez √† niveau votre GPU/CPU

Mettez √† niveau votre GPU et votre CPU environ tous les quatre ans pour que tout fonctionne bien. Mais si vous √™tes un joueur, vous devrez peut-√™tre le faire plus t√¥t, car la technologie √©volue beaucoup plus rapidement dans ce secteur.

Le choix de la premi√®re mise √† niveau d√©pend des types de jeux auxquels vous jouez. Si vous n‚Äôavez pas besoin de graphismes extr√™mes et jouez √† des jeux plus rapides, le processeur est le meilleur choix. Mais si vous aimez les histoires num√©riques ou les jeux bas√©s sur le monde avec beaucoup de personnages et d‚Äôarri√®re-plans non jouables, un GPU pourrait vous √™tre plus utile.

Quoi qu‚Äôil en soit, assurez-vous que l‚Äô√©quilibre des performances entre les deux est d√©licat, car l‚Äôun ne fonctionne pas sans l‚Äôautre. V√©rifiez la m√©moire et la bande passante de toute mise √† niveau potentielle.

Mettez votre RAM √† niveau

La mise √† niveau de votre RAM n‚Äôaura pas un effet aussi important que la mise √† niveau du processeur ou du GPU. Mais elle peut donner √† votre mat√©riel le coup de pouce dont il a besoin pour augmenter votre fr√©quence d‚Äôimages et am√©liorer votre exp√©rience de jeu globale.

De nombreux jeux requi√®rent une m√©moire vive de 8 Go, mais ce chiffre augmente r√©guli√®rement, car les titres les plus r√©cents recommandent une m√©moire vive de 12 Go.

Si vous voulez rester en t√™te de la courbe, 16 Go suffiront pour l‚Äôinstant. Mais si vous voulez utiliser des services de streaming en arri√®re-plan comme Twitch, Discord et YouTube, vous devrez passer √† 32 Go pour pouvoir tout faire fonctionner sans probl√®me.

D√©sactiver l‚Äôalgorithme de Nagle

En gros, l‚Äôalgorithme de Nagle am√©liore l‚Äôefficacit√© des r√©seaux TCP/IP en cr√©ant des paquets de donn√©es, ce qui r√©duit le nombre de paquets √† envoyer sur le r√©seau. Ce processus affecte votre connexion Internet, la rendant moins stable. La d√©sactivation de cet algorithme sur votre PC peut contribuer √† des probl√®mes de latence lorsque vous jouez √† des jeux en ligne.

Ouvrez votre Windows √âditeur de registre en cliquant sur la touche Windows + Q, en tapant ‚Äúregedit‚Äù et en cliquant sur le fichier regedit. Faites d√©filer le menu HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE pour trouver le chemin suivant : ‚Äú\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters\Interface‚Äù. Cela vous m√®nera au menu qui comprend des dossiers avec de nombreux chiffres et lettres. Pour acc√©der au bon fichier, faites correspondre votre adresse IP √† l‚Äôadresse DhcpIPAddress list√©e dans l‚Äôun de ces dossiers.

Pour trouver votre adresse IP, appuyez sur la touche Windows + X et suivez ces √©tapes : Panneau de configuration - R√©seau et Internet - Centre R√©seau et partage - Connexions - D√©tails - Adresse IPv4.

Vous pouvez maintenant retrouver le dossier avec la bonne adresse IP. Cliquez avec le bouton droit de la souris sur ce dossier et s√©lectionnez Nouveau - Valeur DWORD (32 bits). Vous devrez cr√©er deux de ces valeurs : TcpAckFrequency et TCPNoDelay. Double-cliquez sur chacune d‚Äôelles et r√©glez leurs param√®tres sur 1. L‚Äôalgorithme de Nagle est maintenant d√©sactiv√©.

Surcadencez votre carte graphique

Overclocker vos cartes graphiques signifie les pousser au-del√† des sp√©cifications affich√©es sur la bo√Æte. De nombreuses cartes r√©centes disposent d‚Äôune fonction automatique permettant de le faire dans les param√®tres de contr√¥le, mais il existe √©galement des moyens de le faire manuellement. Veillez √† bien conna√Ætre votre carte graphique, car si vous repoussez ses limites, elle risque de surchauffer.

Pour overclocker :

  1. V√©rifiez les param√®tres standard ou de r√©f√©rence de votre carte.
  2. Utilisez un programme comme MSI Afterburner pour augmenter l‚Äôhorloge centrale de la carte. Faites-le par intervalles de 10 MHz et r√©initialisez les benchmarks au fur et √† mesure.
  3. En option, vous pouvez √©galement augmenter le voltage et l‚Äôhorloge de la m√©moire, mais surveillez de pr√®s la temp√©rature de votre carte lorsque vous faites cela.
  4. Jouez √† un jeu et v√©rifiez les performances.

D√©sactiver SysMain et Prefetch

C‚Äôest l‚Äôun des services faciles √† d√©sactiver sur Windows 10. Ces programmes essaient de vous aider √† acc√©der plus rapidement aux donn√©es, mais ils ajoutent finalement des op√©rations inutiles qui ralentissent les jeux. Voici comment les d√©sactiver :

SysMain

  • Appuyez sur Win + R pour ouvrir l‚Äôinvite Ex√©cuter.
  • Tapez msc et appuyez sur Entr√©e.
  • Double-cliquez sur SysMain.
  • S√©lectionnez D√©sactiv√© dans la liste d√©roulante.
  • Cliquez sur OK.

Pr√©f√©rez

  • Appuyez sur Win + R pour ouvrir l‚Äôinvite d‚Äôex√©cution.
  • Tapez ‚Äúregedit >‚Äù et appuyez sur Entr√©e.
  • Cliquez sur Oui.
  • Allez dans PrefetchParameters dans HKLM.
  • Double-cliquez sur la valeur REG_DWORD EnablePrefetcher.
  • D√©finissez la valeur sur 0.
  • Cliquez sur OK.

Comment acc√©l√©rer l‚Äôex√©cution des jeux sur un ordinateur portable Windows 10

Vous voulez savoir comment am√©liorer les performances de jeu sur un ordinateur portable Windows 10 ? Ces conseils vous aideront √† acc√©l√©rer les choses !

Utiliser une alimentation externe

Windows 10 dispose de nombreuses fonctions d‚Äô√©conomie d‚Äô√©nergie pour les ordinateurs portables afin de les maintenir en vie pendant de plus longues dur√©es. Cela affectera consid√©rablement l‚Äôexp√©rience de jeu car votre RAM, vos cartes graphiques et votre CPU ne fonctionneront pas √† pleine capacit√©. Pour rem√©dier √† ce probl√®me, connectez votre ordinateur portable √† son alimentation externe et assurez-vous que vos param√®tres de contr√¥le permettent d‚Äôobtenir des performances optimales lorsqu‚Äôil est connect√©.

Utiliser un plan d‚Äôalimentation performant

Pour modifier votre plan d‚Äôalimentation, cliquez sur la touche Windows + I, tapez ‚Äúalimentation‚Äù dans la zone de recherche, choisissez Param√®tres d‚Äôalimentation et de veille, puis Param√®tres d‚Äôalimentation suppl√©mentaires. Si vous ne voyez pas de plan d‚Äôalimentation haute performance dans la partie gauche de l‚Äô√©cran, cliquez sur Cr√©er un plan d‚Äôalimentation et choisissez Haute performance.

Emp√™chez votre ordinateur portable de surchauffer

Les ordinateurs portables sont r√©put√©s pour leur surchauffe, car tous les composants sont serr√©s dans le ch√¢ssis et l‚Äôair circule peu. En cas de surchauffe, le syst√®me ralentit et les performances de jeu aussi. Utilisez ces conseils de pr√©vention :

  1. V√©rifiez et nettoyez toujours vos ventilateurs.
  2. Pour la ventilation, essayez de sur√©lever votre ordinateur portable ou utilisez un bureau con√ßu pour les ordinateurs portables.
  3. R√©glez les param√®tres de vos ventilateurs pour qu‚Äôils ne soient pas trop sollicit√©s.
  4. Si vous le pouvez, jouez sur votre ordinateur portable dans un environnement frais.

Mettez √† niveau votre GPU et votre RAM

Nous avons d√©j√† abord√© ce sujet pour les PC, mais votre ordinateur portable peut √©galement √™tre √©quip√© d‚Äôun processeur graphique et d‚Äôune m√©moire vive. Suivez les m√™mes protocoles, et si vous n‚Äôavez pas l‚Äôhabitude de travailler avec des ordinateurs portables, il est pr√©f√©rable de confier l‚Äôinstallation √† un technicien exp√©riment√©.

D√©sactiver les services d‚Äôarri√®re-plan Windows

Les ordinateurs portables sont souvent √©quip√©s de nombreux services d‚Äôarri√®re-plan qui fonctionnent pour √©viter la surchauffe et optimiser les performances avec des composants plus petits. Ces services peuvent facilement nuire aux performances de jeu s‚Äôils ne sont pas d√©sactiv√©s. Voici les √©tapes √† suivre :

  1. Appuyez sur les touches Windows + R et utilisez l‚Äôinvite Ex√©cuter.
  2. Tapez ‚Äúmsconfig‚Äù et cliquez sur OK.
  3. Choisissez l‚Äôonglet Services.
  4. Cochez la case Masquer tous les services Microsoft.
  5. S√©lectionnez Tout d√©sactiver, puis cliquez sur Appliquer et OK.
  6. S√©lectionnez Red√©marrer dans la bo√Æte de dialogue qui s‚Äôouvre.

R√©sum√©

Nous esp√©rons que cet article vous a donn√© quelques id√©es sur la fa√ßon de faire fonctionner les jeux plus rapidement sur Windows 10 et d‚Äôam√©liorer votre exp√©rience de jeu. Voici quelques-uns des principaux conseils √† utiliser pour optimiser votre syst√®me :

  • Modifiez les param√®tres de vos jeux : Vous pouvez √©ventuellement modifier des √©l√©ments comme la r√©solution, le flou de mouvement et l‚Äôanticr√©nelage.
  • Mettez votre mat√©riel √† niveau : si votre RAM, votre GPU ou votre CPU ne sont pas √† la hauteur, il est peut-√™tre temps de les mettre √† niveau pour les jeux modernes et une meilleure exp√©rience de jeu.
  • Modifiez les param√®tres de votre carte graphique : Les cartes graphiques modernes ont leurs propres param√®tres que vous pouvez ajuster pour optimiser votre syst√®me pour les jeux. V√©rifiez les param√®tres de l‚Äôocclusion ambiante, du filtrage anisotropique et du DSR.

Gecata by Movavi

Logiciel d‚Äôenregistrement de jeux et de streaming gratuit et simple

T√©l√©charger gratuitement √Ä propos de la version Windows

T√©l√©charger gratuitement √Ä propos de la version Windows

Foire aux questions

Comment optimiser mon ordinateur pour les jeux ?

L‚Äôarticle ci-dessus √©num√®re une s√©rie de mesures que vous pouvez prendre pour optimiser votre ordinateur portable ou de bureau pour les jeux. Voici les principaux conseils :

  • V√©rifiez vos param√®tres graphiques dans le jeu.
  • Modifiez les param√®tres de votre carte graphique
  • Mettez √† niveau votre GPU et/ou votre CPU
  • V√©rifiez les param√®tres de performance de votre Windows.

Qu‚Äôest-ce qui ralentit mon ordinateur ?

Il y a une longue liste de choses qui pourraient ralentir votre ordinateur. Voici une liste de raisons que vous pouvez v√©rifier :

  1. L‚Äôalgorithme de Nagle est activ√©
  2. Votre ordinateur ex√©cute des mises √† jour sur des heures non actives
  3. Les pilotes du GPU ne sont pas √† jour
  4. Vous utilisez DirectX 11 et devez effectuer une mise √† jour.
  5. Le syst√®me fonctionne avec des param√®tres de performance inf√©rieurs pour √©conomiser la batterie.

Comment faire fonctionner un ordinateur plus rapidement ?

Si vous voulez savoir comment rendre votre ordinateur plus rapide pour jouer, voici quelques conseils rapides :

  1. Passez √† une carte SSD
  2. D√©sinstallez tous les programmes inutilis√©s
  3. Effectuez un nettoyage du disque et une maintenance du syst√®me
  4. Passez en revue votre programme de d√©marrage et d√©sactivez ceux que vous n‚Äôutilisez pas.
  5. Installez de la RAM suppl√©mentaire

Windows 10 est-il meilleur pour les jeux ?

Lorsque l‚Äôon compare l‚Äôexp√©rience de jeu des versions pr√©c√©dentes de Windows √† Windows 10, l‚Äôam√©lioration des performances est extraordinaire. Si vous n‚Äô√™tes pas s√ªr de vouloir faire une mise √† jour, la d√©cision est simple. Windows 10 offrira toujours une meilleure exp√©rience.

Comment obtenir 60 fps dans un jeu ?

Atteindre 60 FPS dans un jeu n‚Äôest pas diff√©rent des conseils pour acc√©l√©rer votre syst√®me en g√©n√©ral, mais voici ce que vous pouvez faire :

  1. Am√©liorez votre GPU et votre CPU
  2. Mettez √† niveau ou installez de la RAM suppl√©mentaire
  3. Passez Windows 10 en ‚Äúmode jeu‚Äù.
  4. V√©rifiez les param√®tres graphiques de votre jeu.
  5. Installez les derniers pilotes pour votre carte graphique

Pourquoi ai-je des fps faibles sur mon PC haut de gamme ?

La baisse du nombre de FPS se produit lorsque votre ordinateur n‚Äôa pas la m√©moire ou la puissance n√©cessaire pour faire tourner le jeu √† pleine vitesse. Parmi les probl√®mes les plus courants √† l‚Äôorigine d‚Äôune baisse du nombre d‚Äôimages par seconde, citons les pilotes de cartes graphiques obsol√®tes, les cartes graphiques de qualit√© inf√©rieure, les vieux processeurs et le manque de m√©moire vive.

Ce n‚Äôest pas parce que vous d√©pensez de l‚Äôargent pour un ordinateur qu‚Äôil est √©quip√© du dernier cri. Le mat√©riel est plus important que les autres caract√©ristiques de conception ou de logiciel. En outre, les jeux vid√©o modernes placent toujours la barre plus haut en mati√®re de capacit√© de performance, ce qui est donc relatif d‚Äôun jeu √† l‚Äôautre.

Avez-vous des questions ?

entry.title: Solution Guide: Overcoming Steam Account Login Problems
entry.content:
Overcoming the Destiny 2 Centipede Glitch - Solution Found

Many players have been reporting theError Code Centipede on Destiny 2 for PC, PS5/PS4, and Xbox. If you also get the Centipede Error, it means that you‚Äôre not able to connect to Destiny servers currently. The good news is there are some working fixes available. Read on and find out what they are.

Try these fixes‚Ä¶

You don‚Äôt have to try them all; just work your way down the list until you find the one that does the trick!

1: Check Destiny 2 server status

2: Check your Internet connection

3: Choose NAT Type 1/Open NAT

4: Update your network adapter driver

5: Use a VPN when your Internet access is restricted

Before we dive into anything advanced, please try to restart the game and your PC to see if it‚Äôs a random one-time error.

Fix 1: Check Destiny 2 server status

Since the Error Centipede is a general networking error, the first thing you can do is to check if the server is down. If Destiny 2 is undergoing maintenance, you won‚Äôt be able to connect to the server and thus may get the Centipede Error.

You can refer to theBungie Help page andBungie Help official Twitter for upcoming maintenance schedules and real-time notifications.

If Destiny 2 servers are working as intended, then the problem may be with your Internet connection. Read on for some fixes to configure your Internet settings and resolve the Error Centipede on Destiny 2.

Fix 2: Check your Internet connection

If your Internet connection is unstable or slow, you may get the Error Centipede when trying to log in to Destiny 2. There are a few things you should pay attention to and configure as needed:

  • It‚Äôs recommended toplay Destiny 2 on a wired connection . A wired connection is usually more stable and can be faster.
  • If you need to play on Wi-Fi, make sure it‚Äôs not overcrowded. You candisconnect other devices from the Wi-Fi . You canset up your PC or console somewhere closer to the router to increase the stability and reduce Wi-Fi connection problems for Destiny 2.
  • One more thing to try:power cycle your router and modem . All you need to do is to unplug the cables from your router and your modem, wait for at least 30 seconds, then plug the cables back into both devices.
  • You can alsorun an Internet speed test to see if there‚Äôs anything wrong. If your Internet speed appears to be unreasonably low, you may need to contact your Internet Service Provider for help.

If you still get the Error Centipede, try the next fix.

Fix 3: Choose NAT Type 1/Open NAT

When you get the Error Centipede on Destiny 2, you‚Äôll need to make sure your connection is not restricted and can connect to Destiny 2 servers. It‚Äôs recommended to set your NAT to Type 1/Open for a stable connection to Destiny servers.

NAT is short for Network Address Translation. Put simply, it operates on your router and allows a single IP address to represent all the devices on your private network. To configure your NAT settings, you‚Äôll either need to enable UPnP or set up Port Forwarding. It‚Äôs usually recommended totry only one method , unless the first one doesn‚Äôt work for you.

Option 1: Enable UPnP

Bungie recommends players to enable UPnP when they encounter network issues, since it‚Äôs related to how players are connected within Destiny 2. Here‚Äôs how to set up your UPnP:

  1. Press theWindows logo key andR on your keyboard to invoke the Run box.
  2. Type incmd , then pressShift andEnter to run the command prompt with admin permissions.
  3. Type inipconfig , then pressEnter . Copy the address of yourdefault gateway as we‚Äôll need them for the next steps.
  4. Now open your browser,paste the default gateway address you copied before into the address bar, and pressEnter .
  5. You‚Äôll need to enter credentials (username and password) to log into your router‚Äôs control panel.
  6. Once you‚Äôre logged in, look for UPnP settings. The location may differ on different brands, you can refer to user manuals or turn to specialists for help.
  7. Enable UPnP , and save the changes.

You can now test a game to see if you still get the Centipede Error.

Option 2: Port Forwarding

Port Forwarding works on incoming Internet connections. It routes an outside internet connection to use the open ports, which will allow you to connect to Destiny 2. This process is a bit difficult than enabling UPnP, technically speaking, but it‚Äôs generally a little safer. There are a few steps to do, here we‚Äôll divide them into Step 1,2, and 3.

Step 1: Get IP address information

  1. Press theWindows logo key andR to invoke the Run box.
  2. Type incmd , then pressShift andEnter to run the command prompt as Admin.
  3. Type inipconfig /all , then pressEnter . Record the information that we‚Äôre gonna use in the following steps:IPv4 Address, Subnet Mask, Default Gateway, and DNS Servers .

Step 2: Assign a static IP address

  1. Press theWindows logo key andR to invoke the Run box.
  2. Type innpca.cpl , then click OK.
  3. Click on theEthernet icon , right-click it then clickProperties .
  4. SelectInternet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4) , then clickProperties .


5. SelectUse the following IP address andUse the following DNS server addresses . Fill in the information you recorded in Step 1:IP address, Subnet mask, Default gateway, DNS servers . Once complete, clickOK .

Step 3: Set up Port Forwarding

  1. Copy-paste thedefault gateway address into the address bar on your browser to log into your router‚Äôs control panel. You‚Äôll need to know the username and password for this step.
  2. Find thePort Forwarding settings . The name of this setting may differ on the router‚Äôs brands, so you may need to navigate a bit or refer to user manuals for help.
  3. Fill in your static IP address accordingly.
  4. Type in the port numbers you want to use (See the tables below for ports that should be opened or forwarded for Destiny 2.)
  5. For protocol status, choose as needed (Also refer to the tables below.)
  6. Once complete, enable the new Port Forwarding rule with an Enable or On option.

Ports that should be OPEN

PlatformTCP Destination PortsUDP Destination Ports
Xbox Series X**|** S53, 80, 307453, 88, 500, 3544, 3074, 27015-27200

If setting up the NAT type doesn‚Äôt solve your problem, try the next fix.

Fix 4: Update your network adapter driver

If you‚Äôve tried the above fixes but nothing worked, then it‚Äôs likely that you would need to check your driver. An outdated or faulty network adapter driver could lead to random networking problems, so you may want to make sure yours is up-to-date and functioning properly.

There are two ways you can get the right driver for your network adapter:manually orautomatically .

Manual driver update ‚Äì You can update the network adapter driver via Device Manager . But sometimes Windows may fail to detect an available update because its database isn‚Äôt updated as frequently.

Automatic driver update ‚Äì If you don‚Äôt have the time, patience, or computer skills to update your driver manually, you can, instead, do it automatically with Driver Easy . Driver Easy will automatically recognize your system and find the correct driver for your network adapter and your Windows version, then it will download and install it correctly:

  1. Download and install Driver Easy.

  2. Run Driver Easy and click the Scan Now button. Driver Easy will then scan your computer and detect any problem drivers.

  1. Click the Update button next to the flagged network adapter driver to automatically download the correct version of the driver, then you can manually install it (you can do this with the FREE version).

Or click Update All to automatically download and install the correct version of all the drivers that are missing or out of date on your system. Here for example, I can update the graphics driver on my PC as well. (This requires the Pro version which comes with full support and a 30-day money-back guarantee. You‚Äôll be prompted to upgrade when you click Update All.)

The Pro version of Driver Easy comes with full technical support.
If you need assistance, please contact Driver Easy‚Äôs support team at support@drivereasy.com .

Restart your PC for the new drivers to take effect. If this doesn‚Äôt solve the Error Centipede for you, try the last fix.

Fix 5: Use a VPN when your Internet access is restricted

When you try to play Destiny 2 on campus or in a hotel, anywhere that‚Äôs likely to restrict your Internet access, you‚Äôll likely get the Error Centipede. If this is the case, it‚Äôs unlikely to get assistance from the Internet Service Provider. But the good news is, you can use a VPN.

Bungie doesn‚Äôt limit the use of VPN for playing Destiny 2. As long as you use a VPN safely and don‚Äôt seem to cause any problems/disadvantages for other players, you won‚Äôt get a VPN ban from Bungie.

There are many choices on the VPN market, but it‚Äôs recommended NOT to use free VPNs because they can be highly risky and your data may be sold. If you‚Äôre not sure which VPNs are compatible with Destiny 2, our best pick isNordVPN .

It‚Äôs one of the safest and fastest VPNs out there, providing over 5,300 servers in 59 countries and the best security features. NordVPN offers a 30-day money-back guarantee, so don‚Äôt hesitate to give it a try and enjoy Destiny 2 with a VPN!

You may also like:Latest NordVPN coupons and deals ‚Äì 100% Valid

Hopefully this article is helpful and you can now enjoy Destiny 2 without the annoying Error Centipede!

entry.title: Yakuza: Like a Dragon - Perfectly Ported & Powerful Gameplay on Personal Computers!
entry.content:
Smooth Gaming Experience: Destiny 2‚ÄôS Beyond Light Update Successfully Launched on Personal Computers

Destiny 2: Beyond Light, another gorgeous expansion for Destiny 2, is one of the most popular PC games since release. However, according to many players, the game crashes either on launch or in the middle of the gameplay. That‚Äôs very irritating, but in fact, this problem can be fixed easily.

Try these fixes

We‚Äôve collected 5 working fixes for Destiny 2 Beyond Light crashing. You don‚Äôt have to try them all; just work from the top down until you find the one that does the trick.

  1. Verify the integrity of your game files
  2. Update your graphics driver
  3. Set high priority
  4. Disable the shader cache
  5. Reinstall Destiny 2: Beyond Light

The screenshots below come from Windows 10, but the fixes also apply to Windows 7, 8 and 11.

Fix 1 ‚Äì Verify the integrity of your game files

Missing or damaged game files is a common cause of most gaming issues. So if your Destiny 2 Beyond Light keeps crashing, it‚Äôs a good idea to validate the game files first.

  1. Launch your Steam client and navigate to theLibrary tab.
  2. Right-clickDestiny 2: Beyond Light from the game list, and clickProperties .


3. Select theLocal Files tab, and clickVerify Integrity of Game Files .

It will take a few minutes for Steam to detect and repair any corrupted files. Upon completion, you can relaunch Beyond Light to see if it crashes again. If yes, proceed to more fixes below.

Fix 2 ‚Äì Update your graphics driver

The Destiny 2 Beyond Light crashing issue may indicate your graphics card driver is corrupted or out-of-date. To ensure a smooth and immersive gaming experience, you should keep your graphics driver up-to-date at all times.

To update your graphics driver the safe way, here are two options: manually or automatically .

Option 1 ‚Äì Update the graphics driver manually

GPU manufacturers keep releasing new drivers to fix bugs with new titles and improve game performance. You can visit their official websites and download the correct drivers corresponding with your Windows version:

  • NVIDIA
  • AMD

Once you‚Äôve downloaded the correct drivers for your system, double-click the file and follow the on-screen instructions to install the driver.

Option 2 ‚Äì Update the graphics driver automatically (recommended)

If you don‚Äôt have the time, patience or computer skills to update your graphics driver manually, you can, instead, do it automatically with Driver Easy .

Driver Easy will automatically recognize your system and find the correct drivers for your exact graphics card and your Windows version, and it will download and install them correctly:

  1. Download and install Driver Easy.
  2. Run Driver Easy and click theScan Now button. Driver Easy will then scan your computer and detect any problem drivers.
  3. ClickUpdate All to automatically download and install the correct version of all the drivers that are missing or out of date on your system (this requires the Pro version ‚Äì you‚Äôll be prompted to upgrade when you clickUpdate All ). You can also clickUpdate to do it for free, but it‚Äôs partly manual.

The Pro version of Driver Easy comes with full technical support.
If you need assistance, please contact Driver Easy‚Äôs support team at support@drivereasy.com .

Test how Destiny 2 Beyond Light works after the driver update. If the crashes persist, move on to the next fix below.

Fix 3 ‚Äì Set high priority

Setting high priority for Beyond Light allows it to access more system resources than other programs and thus run more smoothly. Here‚Äôs how:

  1. Right-click any empty space on the taskbar and clickTask Manager .
  2. Select theDetails tab.


3. Right-click theDestiny 2: Beyond Light.exe file . Then, mouse overSet priority and selectAbove normal orHigh .

Click here


4. ClickChange priority to confirm.

Relaunch the game and check whether it runs properly or not. If not, there are two more fixes below.

Fix 4 ‚Äì Disable the shader cache

If you‚Äôre using an NVIDIA graphics card, it‚Äôs possible the shader cache has messed up with Destiny 2 Beyond Light and caused the glitches. Try disabling this option to see if the crash stops.

  1. Right-click any blank area on the desktop, and clickNVIDIA Control Panel .
  2. Click3D Settings >Manage 3D settings on the left pane.


3. Under the Global Settings section, scroll down andturn off Shader Cache .

4. Go toC:\ProgramData\NVIDIA Corporation\NV_Cache anddelete the content of that folder . (You can also copy them and store them elsewhere.)

Launch Beyond Light again and the crashing problem should no longer occur. If not, go to Fix 5 below.

Click here

Fix 5 ‚Äì Reinstall Destiny 2: Beyond Light

A fresh reinstallation can effectively solve stubborn underlying program issues. So, if you‚Äôve attempted all the fixes above but to no avail, try reinstalling the game as a last resort.

  1. Open Steam and click theLibrary tab.
  2. Right-clickDestiny 2 Beyond Light and clickManage >Uninstall .


3. On your keyboard, press theWindows logo key andE at the same time to open File Explorer.

  1. Go to this path:C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common . Then, delete theDestiny 2 Beyond Light folder.

Now that the game is clean removed from your PC, download it again on Steam and check if it works without problems.

Hopefully the simple fixes above are helpful to you. If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to drop a comment below.

  • game crash

entry.content:
Create Stunning Presentations with These Free Apps and Software (Picks)

Movavi Slideshow Maker

Download for Free
